meanings.definition: To make a hole in (a material) wider at the top than at the bottom to allow the head of a screw or bolt to lie below the surface.
meanings.sent1: He countersunk the screw into the wood to ensure a flat surface.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter countersunk the screws to secure the tabletop.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel tried to countersink its acorn into the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her smile countersunk any doubts I had about her sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The sun countersunk behind the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: A hole made in this way.
meanings.sent1: The countersunk in the metal sheet was perfectly aligned with the screw head.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a countersunk on the surface of the wooden plank.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant peeked out from the countersunk, looking for crumbs.
meanings.sent4: The moon resembled a countersunk in the night sky, surrounded by stars.
meanings.sent5: The old tree had a countersunk where birds often nested during spring.
